page.title: 17SHEEP FARMING BALQUHIDDER
page.content: Balquhidder and the surrounding area has long been used for sheep farming, grazing the sturdy black-faced sheep of the Scottish Highlands, a breed known to withstand even the toughest winters. Suffolk sheep have more recently been introduced to some farms. Because winters have been known to be severe and spring can be late in coming, lambing is later here with most lambs born in April. In June shearing time brings out the best of true community spirit with each farmer in turn helping his neighbours with this task. Farming families who have lived in the Glen for generations and can trace their families through a century or two give the community a uniqueness. The new resident is warmly welcomed by these gentlefolk who give of their hospitality generously.
